snippet: Sarah Feinberg, President Obama’s pick to lead the Federal Railroad Administration, faced tough questions from senators considering her nomination.
abstract: Sarah Feinberg, acting head of Federal Railroad Administration since her nomination in May, is questioned by Senate panel weighing her confirmation about railroad industry's claim it cannot meet end-of-year deadline to install positive control technology, which could prevent derailments; Feinberg says agency will enforce deadline and law, but notes Congress alone has power to extend the deadline.
lead_paragraph: Sarah Feinberg, President Obama’s pick to lead the Federal Railroad Administration, faced tough questions from senators considering her nomination.

headline.main: Lawmakers Press Railroad Nominee on Safety Deadline
